inference:
The angle between the line and the plane is the same as the angle between the direction vector of the line and the normal vector of the plane.  Thus,
\[\cos \theta = \frac{\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 6 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} -10 \\ -2 \\ 11 \end{pmatrix}}{\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 3 \\ 6 \end{pmatrix} \right\| \left\| \begin{pmatrix} -10 \\ -2 \\ 11 \end{pmatrix} \right\|} = \frac{40}{7 \sqrt{153}}.\]Hence,
\[\sin \theta = \sqrt{1 - \cos^2 \theta} = \sqrt{1 - \frac{1600}{7653}} = \boxed{\frac{\sqrt{6053}}{7 \sqrt{153}}}.\]
